meanings.definition: A person who creates or maintains a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The cataloger organized all the books in the library.
meanings.sent2: The cataloger at the bookstore helps customers find specific titles.
meanings.sent3: The cataloger accidentally mixed up the fiction and non-fiction sections, creating chaos.
meanings.sent4: She was a cataloger of memories, neatly arranging each moment in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The diligent cataloger meticulously labeled each item with care.

meanings.definition: To create or maintain a catalog of items.
meanings.sent1: She likes to cataloger her stamp collection to keep track of each one.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will cataloger the new books before placing them on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cataloger his extensive movie collection by genre, making it easier to choose what to watch.
meanings.sent4: The scientist sought to cataloger all the species in the forest, documenting each one meticulously.
meanings.sent5: As the storm approached, she hurried to cataloger the emergency supplies in the shelter.
